direction.raw_text: knocks on a bedroom door. The door opens on HARRY PAPADOPOULOS in his bedroom doing up his shirt in a mirror.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 3   EXT. PAPADOPOULOS MANSION - DRIVEWAY. DAY 1.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A chauffeur-driven Mercedes pulls up to the front of the mansion house. MRS PARRINGTON, the housekeeper and nanny, waits for the car. HARRY and his children, JAMES, KATIE and THEO exit through the front door. As they do so, MRS PARRINGTON makes sure the children are smartly turned out. The chauffeur gets out and opens the door for the children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Orphaned when he was just a boy, Harry Papadopoulos came to this country with nothing. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry was a grafter, entering the restaurant trade as a young man. (Beat) That's a euphemism for 'Greek waiter' isn't it? There is some laughter in the audience. We cut to HARRY again, who attempts to smile off the joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only joking Harry. He then started the now famous Papadopoulos & Sons - doing all things Greek. From taramasalata to olive oil and frozen mousakas - which, I must admit, my wife and I are partial to occasionally. Not one to settle, Harry's made the move into commercial property where he's about to embark on one of the most audacious developments yet - Papadopoulos Plaza. A two million square foot redevelopment in the heart of our great city. (Applause from the audience) Ladies and Gentlemen, I give you European Entrepreneur of the Year. Harry Papadopoulos. Awards music. We now cut to HARRY getting up from the table. He momentarily acknowledges the applause. The children are clapping politely but absently.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 4   EXT. CAR MONTAGE. DAY 1.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We see the car make its way through London and images of the City, the Gherkin, NatWest Tower, Canary Wharf. The Mercedes pulls up outside a hotel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 5   INT. LONDON HOTEL - AWARDS CEREMONY. DAY 1.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: is standing behind a lectern, with a large crystal vase award. Behind him, on the stage, we see a 'European Entrepreneur of the Year Award' banner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We cut to the family seated at a round table. The children look bored. HARRY listens proudly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 6   INT. LONDON HOTEL - SMALL FUNCTION SUITE. DAY 1.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's the photo call for 'European Entrepreneur of the Year.' A PHOTOGRAPHER is taking shots of HARRY holding his award. KATIE, JAMES and THEO stand alongside their father. The children look disinterested.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's lovely. (Referring to the vase) Now just hold it up a bit for me. Yeah, that's nice. Bunch up a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just look at the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little bit more. Perfect. Now touch the vase for me, if you don't mind. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Touch it? What a perv.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (With a stammer) Katie. You're the p... p... perv.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're the f.. f.. freak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on guys. Big smiles. Big smiles for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you really work in a restaurant Daddy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long time ago. Touch it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guys. This is supposed to be a celebration. What's the Greek word? Is it Opa? Opa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Touch the vase. The family touch the vase and force a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheese!!!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 7   INT. PAPADOPOULOS MANSION - KITCHEN. EVENING 1.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is drying dishes. HARRY, THEO, KATIE and JAMES are at the table having supper. THEO is on a laptop, checking stock market trends. KATIE is texting. HARRY is reading congratulatory cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations from the Prime Minister. Sir Derek Otterly was there today Mrs Parrington.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir Derek? You must remember him. He's been to the house. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all blur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because they're all so dull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weird. Gold doing well. Tech stocks down. DAVE enters and hands MRS PARRINGTON some empty mugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice one Mrs P.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, thanks Dave. Would you like to stay for some supper?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no. Best not. Got some dinner at home. That's a nice vase, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: European Entrepreneur of the Year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's impressive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave. Did you g.. g.. get my cuttings?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did mate. It's in the greenhouse. I got you a Caryopteris and a Philadelphus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheers man. Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you tomorrow. Dave exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy? What did Papadopoulos & Sons borrow for the property development?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About three hundred million. MRS PARRINGTON shuts and removes THEO's laptop. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never mind the trials and tribulations of the stock market. Finish your supper young man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nanny P!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eat up or there'll be no pudding. I've made you a nice sponge. THEO pulls a childish grimace and starts to breath heavily through his nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two, Four, Eight, 16...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty two, sixty four, 128..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something is happening with interbank lending Daddy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright. We'll talk about it tomorrow. HARRY gets up from the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's going to be a long summer. HARRY exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taking them to a business awards ceremony is hardly a family day out. My suggestion was a cottage in Lyme Regis.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 8   INT. PAPADOPOULOS MANSION - HALLWAY. EVENING 1.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is at the front door in the hallway. He is putting on his muddy boots. HARRY enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave? I need to talk to you about James. It's... Look, you really should be doing that at the back. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. Its. He needs to complete his degree. And this gardening, the horticulture, the plants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a huge distraction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just helping him out during the holidays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I need him to complete his studies and you're diverting his attention. And frankly, it's not what I pay you for. Dave doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't be so churlish. You know, if you were worked for my company you'd probably be fired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Is there anything else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. That's it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodnight Mr. Papadopoulos. DAVE exits. JAMES comes through the hallway. He has overheard some of the conversation and he's upset. He walks past HARRY and flashes him a dirty look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: James. JAMES now stops and returns to say something to his father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wa... wa... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm down. He stops. He takes a couple of deep breaths and composes himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wa.. wa..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need to learn how to... You really need to learn how to express yourself more calmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanker. (Beat) Wanker. JAMES exits up the staircase. HARRY watches him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 9   INT. PAPADOPOULOS MANSION - JAMES' BEDROOM. EVENING 1.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: taps on JAMES' door. There is no answer. He walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: James? Can I come in? JAMES' room resembles a botanical garden. JAMES is at his desk with pots of plants and various tools and test tubes with soil and desk lamps. JAMES looks through a microscope, studying a leaf, ignoring his father. HARRY surveys the room trying to accommodate his son's interest in botany. He notices a poster of Charles Darwin with a quote. He reads it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is not the strongest to survive, nor the most intelligent but those adaptable to change. Fascinating. Charles Darwin. (Latching onto a random plant) Ah. Look at that. (Beat) And that's... JAMES answers without looking up from the microscope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know, that the average garden contains over three and a half million species?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad. I'm not going back to... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's only a year and then you've got a law degree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've no intention of running P.. P.. Papadopoulos & Sons. I can't even pronounce it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. Finish your studies. The plants. It's a hobby. Sure. Give yourself options. You may change your mind about the business. You know, there are a lot of creative roles now in business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like marketing. Alright. Defer the final year. Take a year out, why not? Fine. But don't quit. Your mother would have said the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, your mother would probably have said do what you feel was right but I'd argue she was wrong. And then we'd argue. Probably. And she'd win. That was your mother. At least consider deferring. JAMES thinks about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. I'll consider deferring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Great. Great. So, there you are, it's not a definitely not? HARRY wants to bond but doesn't know where to start. HARRY latches onto an English Ivy in a Union Jack plant pot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this one called?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an ivy. The doorbell rings. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs P!(Pause, waits for a response) Mrs P! Look, I'd better. HARRY goes to exit and then comes back to shake his son's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Well done. For. You know. HARRY heads towards the door and just before he exits he gives an emphatic double thumbs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Closed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes please.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 10   EXT. PAPADOPOULOS MANSION - FRONT DOOR. EVENING 1.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: opens the front door. We see a friendly door-to-door salesman with a charity badge around his neck. He has a plastic basket of cleaning products.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evening boss. Sorry to disturb. I work for a homeless charity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. No thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: New dish cloths?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know how you people operate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a badge. HARRY studies the badge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No mention of a charity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on boss. Give us a break. I'm trying to earn a living here. Look. Got tea towels, surface cleaners, scrubbers, brushes, window sprays, shammies - for drying the car. Cars. THEO appears at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy. You need to see the news! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello there mini boss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's that man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a... he's a... he. He works for a charity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it a cake sale?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cakes? Did you say cakes? Did he say cakes? How do you know? That's what I want to do. Open up a cake shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cakes? Really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cup cakes, individually decorated gingerbread men, bite-sized apple strudels, gooey fudge balls, mini- muffins as well as your traditional fare. Got a business plan and everything. It'll be egalitarian but feel exclusive - sort of my mission statement really. The Progressive People's Cake Shop. With... progressive pricing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's very good. I know a thing or two about the food business as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? I'm looking for investors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Retail's not for me, I'm afraid. Staff. Nightmare. They'll nick your cakes, upset your customers, then do you for wrongful dismissal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Thanks for the encouragement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's buy something. The news Daddy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, how much for...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a shammy. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever. How much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shammy. It's a shammy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to say that word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's a silly word and I don't know what it's for and I don't know if you're genuine. And I'll probably never use it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 11   INT. PAPADOPOULOS MANSION - KITCHEN. EVENING 1.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: walks in with the entire box of cleaning products and hands them to MRS PARRINGTON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. A shammy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come look Daddy. On the TV, we see a 'New Bank Crisis?' banner and a reporter standing outside a bank in the city of London.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn it up. THEO points the remote and turns up the volume.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Panic confusion and chaos. They said it couldn't happen again but today it just did sending shock waves through the world's markets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another bank collapse. The TV images cut to people leaving an office with boxes of their belongings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All 8,000 members of staff have been asked to leave while the bank is put into liquidation. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It comes as a shock but not a surprise. HARRY's mobile phone rings. He answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicholas. I'm watching now. It's insane. I don't know. Why don't you call them? Alright. I'll see you first thing tomorrow. Bye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will this have repercussions on your loan? Harry is lost in thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a very good word Theo. Isn't it? Daddy? Repercussions. (Beat) It's a good word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yes. Sorry. Yes. It's a very good word.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (CONT'D)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 12   EXT. PAPADOPOULOS & SONS FACTORY. DAY 2.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Next morning. Establishing shot. We are at the Papadopoulos & Sons HQ - the exterior of the factory.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 13   INT. PAPADOPOULOS & SONS FACTORY OFFICE. DAY 2.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and NICHOLAS are walking into the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've revalued the property. They're calling in the guarantees. You need to find thirty mil now. Six months to find the rest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if we don't? What happens?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll put you and everything you own into administration. Harry. You took out crazy loans. Our business is making feta cheese for God's sake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gambled it on a shopping mall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could do without these comments right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the finance director of this company Harry. You never listened. Never. It always had to be bigger, better. Like these offices. We didn't need these offices. Do you know how much we paid for that 'work of art ' up there? Do you? Two hundred grand. For a fish. Nicholas points towards a fish hung across the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want me to do Nick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our business was profitable Harry. I was going to retire in two years. I'd like to bring that forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're resigning? Now? The accountants coming in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry Harry. En boro. En boro. NICHOLAS exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicholas!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough. That's enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicholas. Can you believe that? ROB and SOPHIE, an American, enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, fan and hitting? Hey! Fat Laki! You know why they call this guy Fat Laki? SOPHIE shrugs. FAT LAKI indicates how big he once was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. Congratulations. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I stopped eating bread. It's sad though. I loved bread. But. What can you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Sophie. Just relocated from our New York office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. Really pleased to meet you. Can I just say, I'm a huge fan of Greek food. Especially the cakes. I love Baklava.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. The ship's going down and we've got baklava.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I take it the banks are pulling the rug? What are the bastards proposing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've demanded the 300 million we borrowed. Thirty by close of play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweet mother of God. They are sons of bitches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've taken a new position on the value of the property development. It's triggered the guarantees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you sell it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not even a building site yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, its bankruptcy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put something offshore, I said. He wanted to pay his taxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I should have been more Greek about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. It's bankruptcy baby. Not disaster. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Accountants. When it's good, they get paid. When it's bad, they get paid. I want my son to be a lawyer for the same reason. He doesn't get it. So what are the options?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, the obvious is to buy back your own business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trick is finding the investors to back you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the banks will sell back to me because?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because nobody makes pink slop like you do Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The banks just want a quick sale. They have no interest in running your business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's jump on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll talk to private equity firms, VCs, angels. The usual suspects. We'll find someone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What doesn't break you, makes you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah. Therapy. Don't charge me for that, will you? Rob? Don't let her charge me for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 14 HARRY walks through his office and down to the factory floor where he overlooks a small army of oblivious Papadopoulos & Sons employees processing taramasalata into containers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PAPADOPOULOS MANSION - DRIVEWAY. DAY 3.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 14   INT. PAPADOPOULOS & SONS FACTORY OFFICE. DAY 2
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Music continues. We see the front of the house. A standard removal truck is parked outside alongside the Mercedes and a Bentley sports car - displaying (PAPA 1 and PAPA 2 number plates). Two removal men in white overalls and white gloves (almost forensic looking) walk out the front door carrying a large oil painting. A third man stands at the back of the van waiting to receive goods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're going through my things. It's disgusting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are they darling. It's temporary. You'll get it all back. Two bank assessors RUPERT and NIGEL enter. RUPERT has a clipboard with items to be ticked off. NIGEL has a camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Sarcastically) Oh. Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Under his breath) Problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the... kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fabulous finishes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how long's this going to take?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Most of the day, I should think. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what are we allowed to keep?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, well. According to the asset sheet... let's see. Not very much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little rats, with their little claws.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is quite unnecessary Katie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We may as well do this now. That's a nice computer. Oh, don't worry we're not going to, you know, take it... now. Anything interesting? THEO hisses at RUPERT like a snake with an aggressive face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stocks. Everyone's selling. I'm buying. Two, Four, Eight, 16, 32..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Double your numbers quietly Theo and apologise or I'll confiscate that wretched computer for a week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no easy way of doing this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have impeccable taste, by the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We operate very strict guidelines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have your range of Greek dips at home. Don't we Rupert?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As I was saying, we operate very strict guidelines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So. What is legally ours? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, the bank will let you keep
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 16   INT. PAPADOPOULOS MANSION - HALLWAY. DAY 3.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: walks down the stairs and we see removal men assessing the valuables of the house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 17   INT. PAPADOPOULOS MANSION - KITCHEN. DAY 3.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The family, including MRS PARRINGTON, are in the kitchen. THEO is on his laptop. KATIE nervously files her nails. MRS PARRINGTON has made everyone a cup of tea. HARRY is reading a newspaper. JAMES is reading a book. KATIE enters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: in cash. And you're each allowed 1,000 in personal items.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Westwood Gold Label cost more than that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's such a beautiful dress. I couldn't resist looking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love it too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Whispering) I'll sort something out for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Whispering) Thank you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nigel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You seem like such a lovely family. We hate doing this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nigel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right, so 25k cash. And 1000 in personal items. What else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah. Well. One thing that came up in the meeting with HQ this morning. The fish and chip shop. The Three Brothers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What fish and chip shop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That went years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, the bank is unable to seize it as an asset because of its co- ownership with a... Spiros Papadopoulos?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, that's his brother. But they haven't spoken in years.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 18   INT. PAPADOPOULOS MANSION - DINING ROOM. EVENING 4.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The family is sitting at the dining room table watching SPIROS eat. No one else is eating and the table is set for one. The dining room is spartan - less furniture/ no pictures. We see some tea crates stuffed with tissue wrapped objects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was so strange. Oh, James - more lemon son. JAMES passes SPIROS a small plate of quartered lemons. SPIROS sticks his fork into one and squeezes juice over his chicken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. This is so good Mrs P. In all the years, I never stopped thinking about you or your food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still so charming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, I'm sitting there watching the telly and suddenly I see Papadopoulos & Sons. On the TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy over leveraged himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at this little Englezo. Hey! I'm your Uncle Spiros re. I'm your uncle, re manga! I'm going to eat him he's so cute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't eat me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Re gugluthi. He's just like his mother. A little Englishman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because my Mummy was English.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah! I know re! I know. Ah. So! I'm watching the news and I'm thinking, what's my baby brother gone and done now? And just at that moment. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As I'm thinking that thought, in the same split second, the phone rings. And it's him! I mean, it's gotta be some kind of quantum physics there, no? No? Insane. Insane. (To KATIE) Katie. You're so grown up. I can't believe this. You were like... just a girl. Dumpy and spoilt. Look at you now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's still a little spoilt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nanny P!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And dumpy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not so dumpy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, James. Sweet baby James. When you were three. How old was he? Three or four? We used to play fight. Remember? You loved to fight. Why, you broke my nose. Yeah! Fuck that hurt!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spiros.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Sorry. (To THEO) Duck! I said duck. (Quacking).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what you said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell your father. (Quaking) Harry. Thank you for phoning me. No, seriously. I'm so grateful. There's, you know... I know there's so much that we need to sort out, you and I.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we should be celebrating. Yeah? I don't drink anymore. Just so you know. But you don't have to be drunk to dance. That's what I say now. You don't have to be drunk to dance! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fantastic. So. Look. We're losing the house and well everything. It's only temporary. I'm in negotiations with a top corporate finance team to buy it back. But in the meantime, I need to free up some capital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give you whatever I've got but you know, I don't have much money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want your money Spiro. I want to sell the Three Brothers. We'll split it 50/50. I get enough money pay the rent, pay a few bills off and it's great for you because you get some cash to do whatever it is you want to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't sell the Three Brothers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew it! I knew you'd be difficult. I knew it, I knew it, I knew it. You haven't changed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it doesn't feel right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're loving this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No Harry. I want to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you see we're in the shit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gentlemen, please. May I suggest we sleep on this? Before it gets out of hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. This is good advice Mrs P.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry? Harry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Whatever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PAPADOPOULOS MANSION - REAR OF HOUSE. DAY 4.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Music. Time lapse of evening into night. 20   INT. PAPADOPOULOS MANSION - LIVING ROOM. DAY 5.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and MRS PARRINGTON are sitting on a sofa. SPIROS addresses them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't sleep last night. Not a wink. Over and over, in my mind, I was trying to imagine selling the shop. Something here was saying, no, no. I want to help you. All of you. So I prayed for guidance. I asked the Universe. Please help me. Please help me help these people. And I must've fallen asleep not long after. A crazy sleep. And then this dream. Banayia mou. There was this, this music. The most incredible music. And you and me Harry. Running the shop. I woke with tears in my eyes and I knew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. What are you going on about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are going to reopen the Three Brothers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brilliant!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he talking about us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I think he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. It's empty. Useless. We'd get nothing for it. But if we made the Three Brothers great again. Hey! That is our destiny! Okay. It needs work. Sure. But destiny need work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're still crazy. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have. You. You have a better chance of getting through this if we increase the value of the shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not opening a fish and chip shop, I'm Papadopoulos & Sons, I'm on supermarket shelves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God. What would I tell my friends?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know, maybe the truth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Mimicking) I don't know, maybe the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God. Fuck off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .. f.. fuck you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People! Hear me out. If we get it up and running again, we can sell it as a going concern instead of an empty shop. This deal you're working on could take ages. In the meantime, you're getting cash in and you're saving money because it's got two bedrooms. Eh? The Three Brothers is a goldmine. Used to be. Can be again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did you become so practical?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get it fixed. I'm a handyman now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you were a waiter Spiros.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Around too much booze Mrs P. I went travelling. Belgium, America, Brooklyn. I ended up managing a block of apartments in LA. I do painting, decorating, plumbing, electrics, everything. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man who can fix things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got a van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. It's alright everyone. Don't panic. He's got a van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go look at the shop. Let me go and start working on it now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're out of your mind. I know what you're up to. You want to make some money for yourself. That's fine. It's okay. It's okay. At least you're thinking smart these days. But don't involve us in all this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Given the current situation, I think it's worth consideration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? I'm not opening a fish and chip shop. I'm not. I'm not! I'm not! I'm not! Not! Not! What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I have a private word? Now.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 21   INT. PAPADOPOULOS MANSION, HALLWAY. DAY 5.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: You're behaving like a child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs Parrington, with all due respect...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are the father of this family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd rather boil my own head than go back to a chip shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a terrible thing to say. Really. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's unreliable Mrs P. He's irresponsible, he's a talker. He sings. He dances. He plays the bongo drums. He's a waiter. He'll drive us all mad and leave us broke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He seems reformed to me. He doesn't drink anymore. I think he wants to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving back to a chip shop will destroy my children's confidence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seeing you behave like a spoilt brat will do that perfectly well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to smell of fish and chips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The children need a home. I don't give a fig for your bourgeois snobbery. Look at you. Everything has to be a drama with you Greeks. Show some gumption man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So many memories.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we really going to live in that? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to find something good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nonsense. You'll love it! We're going to have a crazy time. We're going to fix this place up. I'm going to teach you how to do some Greek dancing, some singing. We'll fry some good fish. We'll laugh. Good times. SPIROS exits the van leaving the stunned family in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Greeks are back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What Greeks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those Greeks. Hello my old friends. Mehmet. Find out what they're up to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See. It looks much worse from the outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's actually a fish and chip shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course it is you spanner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy. Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this? THEO picks out an old plaque-mounted stuffed fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Mr Charles. Our lucky fish. He helped us make the busiest chip shop in London. SPIROS takes in a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can smell the past. Your father and I. Young. The women. Young. Making good money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wasting it. Gambling it. Losing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a crack den!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. Let me show you the rest. We'll make it homely. Furniture, beds,
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 22   EXT. SPIROS' VAN MONTAGE. DAY 6.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Music. We see the family get into Spiros' tatty white van. SPIROS loads up some suitcases into the back. HARRY carries his businessman of the year award. JAMES has some plants. THEO has his laptop. KATIE has designer dress bags and shoes. On the side of the van we see "The Honest Handyman" with a telephone number and the strapline, "If it's still broke... then we can't fix it. That's honesty!" The logo is a hammer with angel wings. The van pulls out of the drive. 23   EXT. THE THREE BROTHERS. DAY 6.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The van pulls up in front of The Three Brothers Fish and Chip Shop. The door is boarded up and covered in posters. We see the old sign, "The Three Brothers". The family, still seated in the van, stare out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Across the road in the Bogazi Kebab Shop, HASSAN ALI and MEHMET (his son) are standing in front of the shop. They watch as the Papadopoulos family exit the van.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 25   INT. DAY. THE THREE BROTHERS - RESTAURANT AREA. DAY 6.    25 We are inside The Three Brothers. We hear a jangle of keys and the door opens. The family walk in led by SPIROS. KATIE still carries her designer clothes bags and shoes, JAMES carries some plants, THEO his laptop and HARRY walks in last. It is an old fashioned fish and chip shop that hasn't traded in 30 years. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Come on. Let me show you. So... here is the prep room... The children follow SPIROS through the shop. HARRY is left looking at the place, taking it all in. He takes out his mobile and calls.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A phone rings at SOPHIE's office within Mortimer Rolf and Jones, HARRY's accountancy firm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mortimer Rolf and Jones? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. Could I speak to Rob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not at his desk. Can I take a message?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Harry Papadopoulos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh hi. It's Sophie. We met at your office, the other day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh hi. Any news?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're lining up interest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. Well, I just need to know... I need to know if this is going to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rest assured. We'll be driving the herd to Abilene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an old American, Mid-West expression. (Beat) Are you okay Mr. Papadopoulos?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep, all good. Just keep me informed please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. HARRY hangs up. ROB enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry Papadopoulos called. You should call him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go out, yeah. Let's celebrate. Let's find... I don't know... Let's find a... salsa club or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy just put another pig in da bag. Owch! A new instruction. Wallinghams. Big UK retail chain. Established. (Wallinghams jingle) Leave it... Leave it to Wallinghams... Comfortably, elegantly, reliably. Wallinghams. (Voice-over mode) Croydon, Greenwich, Enfield, Wimbledon and... Ding! Going into administration. Coming to little old moi for services rendered. (Tommy Cooper) Thank you. Oh thank you very much. God I love an economic downturn. Joking aside though. Five thousand laid off. Sad. Very, very sad. But dear sweet mother of God it was a shit business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah. Hallelujah! (He goes to exit) Six?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two, four, eight, sixteen... Two, four, eight...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy, come at look at this giant mushroom I've found.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 27   INT DAY. THE THREE BROTHERS - RESTAURANT AREA. DAY 6.     27 HARRY is on the verge of a panic attack. He slowly starts to double numbers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 28   EXT. THE THREE BROTHERS - ROOF TERRACE. DAY 6.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and THEO walk up a steel staircase onto the Three Brother's roof terrace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Yeah, yeah, yeah. Hey. Remember up here? We used to bring out the tables and chairs with the other Greeks. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What ever happened to Soula, Pani and Stavro? I loved that crowd. Sometimes there'd be a poker game. Sometimes dancing. We had fun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did my Daddy dance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I taught him. And your mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Mummy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Manga. This is the place where your Mummy and Daddy met.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Up here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. They talked all night. They danced. Yeah, there was a lot of dancing here. Hey. You want me to show you? How about it? SPIROS clicks his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spiros please. It's not a holiday. Just show everyone around. HARRY exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? (To THEO) I'll show you later. (To JAMES) You alright?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. No, I like the view. I might put some plants up here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have a light? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You came all this way for a light? KATIE hands him a lighter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm from the kebab shop across the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice. Silence. MEHMET's run out things to say. They both smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Dad wants me to spy on you. I don't think he like Greeks. (More silence) You want to go out sometime?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, alright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Mehmet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Katie. (They shake hands) It's shit here, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Pretty much. (Looking around) Yeah. Catch you later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Bye. MEHMET walks back to his shop. KATIE smiles. Music - Athina, Athina by The Trio Attico . HARRY steps outside the shop. He looks at KATIE who is still smoking. He stands there for a moment looking a little lost. He gets into SPIROS' van and drives away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 29   EXT. THE THREE BROTHERS. DAY 6.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: is outside the shop, having a cigarette. We see Mehmet approach.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 30   EXT. CITY OF LONDON CEMETERY. DAY 6.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: drives to a cemetery. He parks the van and exits with flowers. Harry walks through the cemetery. We see his wife's 'In Loving Memory of Elizabeth Papadopoulos 1962-2001 - Devoted mother and wife'. He lays down his flowers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 31   INT. MORTIMER ROLF & JONES - SOPHIE'S OFFICE. DAY 7.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is at her desk. We see the same type of flowers in a vase as Harry has laid down at the cemetery. The phone rings. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mortimer, Rolf and Jones. Oh hi Dad. Yeah, I got them. They're beautiful. Thank you. Alright. Put her on. ROB enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Whispering) Right. Just a second. Hi mom. Thanks for the flowers, they're lovely. There was nothing wrong with New York. Yes, you can stay friends with Matt. And Bill and Susan. Mom, look, I've got a meeting. I don't know. Some meeting. Yeah, I promise, I will. I love you. Okay, bye. Bye. SOPHIE puts the phone down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Parents. Is Matt your...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. A bit of a tosser, yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't say tosser exactly. We just wanted different things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yada, yada, yada. Yeah, I hear ya. It's like me and my ex. She was keen and everything but I don't know, her forward thinking sort of killed the romance. Yeah. (Silence) It's good to have these little chats. Shouldn't always be about work. Society is so work obsessed. Tragic. Right. Back to work.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 32   INT. MORTIMER, ROLF & JONES - ROB'S OFFICE. DAY 7.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Seated around a conference table is ROB, SOPHIE and HARRY. HARRY studies a spreadsheet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some big names.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pap & Sons is still a cash cow. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the potential deal structure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the pisser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd still be key to running the business, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Money isn't cheap Harry. These guys will want at least 95% of the company.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leaving me with nothing. I'd do the same thing. I'd be CEO of Papadopoulos & Sons. Get a salary. Get my house back. My children's future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It beats fish and chips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd be working for someone else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be working for someone else. By the way, I'm not actually running a fish and chip shop. Just helping my brother relaunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Listen, there maybe another way. Came up in conversation with the Norske Velconan Bank. It'd be along the lines of a straight loan to buy back the business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would they lend me the money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well. Let's ask them. Want me to look into it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, no choice. ROB's mobile alarm goes off. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Cool. Got to go. Got an emergency with - get this - a high tech portable toilet company - that has literally gone down the tubes. (ROB holds up a flyer for the company) An internet ready, wireless, crapper with a waterproof keyboard and screen. For the love of God. Because taking a dump needed an overhaul. Still, somebody's got to bury them. Inomine patre, Spiritu, Sanctu... etc, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got to love a downturn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laters. ROB exits. SOPHIE starts to pack her files.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think what you're currently doing with your brother sounds liberating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm liberating myself of my last 25 grand on a disused chip shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But its like a startup. Isn't that the most exciting phase of any venture? Taking a bit of a risk. Developing your products and your services. Learning about your market. Look, some of the largest companies on the planet never make a profit. Like a real profit. It's all accounting tricks and leveraged debt. What I'm trying to say is, does it matter if the business is a small one? As long as it makes a profit and the people who work there are happy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing working in a place like this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is only temporary. I got divorced recently. Came to London for a fresh start. I'm actually looking into setting up my own business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm sorry about that. About the divorce, I mean. Not... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been meaning to ask. Can I come and visit your shop sometime?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There isn't one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When it's up and running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a chip shop. It's hot. On your feet all hours. Verbal abuse from customers on a Friday night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't applying for a job Harry. Just wanted to stop by. SOPHIE exits.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 33   INT. THE THREE BROTHERS - THEO'S BEDROOM. NIGHT 8.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is in bed on his laptop. SPIROS knocks and enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's late. What are you doing little man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trading. I watch trends. Making trades based on patterns. I don't even look at the fundamentals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fundamentals?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, capital employed, gearing ratios etc. Not even turnover or profit. It's short term, but I can spot a trend. I know what's going to happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, you can see the future? And?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Same as the past. The pursuit of order from chaos. I'm done for today. SPIROS takes the laptop and closes it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah! Theo, Theo, Theo. Guglouthi mou. Kali Nichta. Onira ylica. Sweet dreams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uncle Spiros? You knew my Mummy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. She was... She was beautiful. And she was very kind to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I had my Mummy sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's very hard for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd have made her laugh, Uncle Spiro.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You make me laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've come out with some classics. Real gems. Wasted on this family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hassn. Thank you for coming. Laki? FAT LAKI passes the kebab to HARRY. HARRY gives it to HASSAN, who passes it to a family member.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kebab's are off the menu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a good man. Thank you. We see KATIE and Mehmet hold hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We must celebrate. The Greek way. Yes? Come on. HASSAN invites Harry to dance. JAMES hits his portable stereo. We hear the opening bars of Siko Horepse Sirtaki.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone get some plates. Get everyone.

direction.raw_text: No, I can't. I actually can't. I... I really don't know... I actually don't know how. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hade re. Just make it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on Harry. I want to learn to. Teach us all how to dance. HARRY, without thinking starts to dance. George Zambetas 'Siko Horepse' plays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad. What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I'm going to dance. And then I'll teach you all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on Daddy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been such a long time since I did this. Amazing how it all comes back to you. Oh... This is! HARRY starts to clap to the music. The others start to clap and form a circle around him. Everyone enjoys the audacity of what HARRY is doing as he starts to dance by himself. People passing by stop to witness the spectacle. HARRY is in the middle, dancing by himself. The camera pulls back as the party of people clapping come together in a circular farandole which takes over the street.
direction.name: direction
